name: Dorchester Hotel

reviews.title: Choose Another Hotel!
reviews.text: I researched this hotel through travelocity. After several attempts to call to make a reservation, I almost gave up due to the fact they would connect you to no extension or an extension that just rang and rang. I should have given up.

reviews.title: Great Location....but that's really all you get.....nothing more!
reviews.text: Finally, I did get through to a reservationist who was very nice.

reviews.title: A Lucky Escape!!!
reviews.text: In summary, the place is not clean, in need or renovation and the people are not helpful. In addition, after leaving the hotel to go to the beach, I came back to my room completely open. Turns out construction folks had to come in and they just left it open afterward.

reviews.title: The place is a disgrace
reviews.text: I had another nights stay in Miami and immediately checked out and went to an AMAZING cute, clean and renovated hotel around the corner called The Cadet. Highly recommend and same price.

reviews.title: Disappointed...deceiving website
reviews.text: I am shocked they charge what they charge.

This place is naasty. Old and smokey. The linens were clean thank god but we had a pink jaccuzzi at the foot of are bed. It reminded me of a 70's P()rn. Save more money and splurge to stay at the Palm or Lowe.
reviews.title: IBEX Show (Rooms and place need update!) Don't stay here.
Burglary in Hotelroom
reviews.text: ...Good location
....Price for location is ok., otherwise overpriced
reviews.title: A negative gesture for the Dorchester

likes.liked: — Close to Lincoln Road and South Beach
likes.disliked: — Loud and dirty. Also terrible internet access.

reviews.text: ....Small hotel, but still very unwellcoming
reviews.title: Not good

reviews.text: ....My suitcase was broken into and ruined (locked and in the
reviews.title: Worst ... Hotel ... Ever

reviews.text: This location is in good walking distance from South Beach but Lincoln Road is right around the corner which was a really cool street to hang out on and eat. I can't remember the name of the little pizza shack on Lincoln but it was the best pizza I've ever had.
reviews.title: uncooperitive, ripoff and they will decieve you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a place to crash after partying in South Beach and Lincoln Road and you're easily going to pass out when you go to bed then this could be the perfect hotel for you. But if you're here for business or relaxation, STAY AWAY!
reviews.title: Terrible hotel -- stay away!!

reviews.text: The hotel was clean and air conditioned (with a $4 per night charge that they don't tell you about). Rooms were ok, no complaints. The hotel could do with some refurbishment of the rooms but the foyer was lovely. My only complaint was at the front desk, with a woman called Viji-who was very rude to all female residents but most friendly with the male ones (much to our amusement). The pool area was lovely, with free drinks from 7-8pm. Very central. If you rent a car DONT PARK at the hotel-it costa $30 per night and parking on the street is safe and costs very little ($4 per night max)
reviews.title: good but surly receptionist

likes.disliked: — the front desk were not interested in helping you-as if you were imposing on them

reviews.text: I had a bit of a mix up with the hotel due to me booking through book it .com the suite that I reserved with a king bed and a pullout sofa wasnt available so I ended up with a room with a queen bed. Despite that and the fact that the pool side bar didnt have what I wanted to drink (Mountain Dew Soda) They wouldnt allow me to drink my soda by the pool. that sucked But overall the staff was wonderful atmosphere was warm and cozy. Great location I would most definetaly stay there again.
reviews.title: Dont bring your personal juice by the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason why this hotel earns two stars is that the price -considering the trendy location- was OK for what we got.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for - but that´s about it

reviews.text: Be prepared to adjust your expectations when you go there. Friends of ours stayed at the Marseilles next door (sister property) with -compared to us - high expectations and got terribly dissappointed.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: We saw the Marseilles room too and it was not a lot better than ours for 50% more of the price per night.
reviews.title: No Surprises, Clean and Close to Everything
It was perfect
reviews.text: Breakfast is prepared by an overworked little old lady. Clearly not geared to people who have to work early in the morning. While I am used to having hotels serve breakfast around 6am, the signs posted at this place declared a 7:30am start. Not too bad, I thought ... but when I came down at 7:30am, the little old lady clearly had not readied everything. There was cereal - but no milk. Coffee was made, but no cups were available. I decided it was faster to go out for breakfast.

reviews.title: A Dump
reviews.text: I asked for a manager, and I was told there were no managers on staff. Is this possible?

I stayed at this hotel in March with 3 of my girlfriends for a weekend Sobe trip. OK there were lots of problems at this hotel...First of all, the hotel was dirty. The hallways had old, dirty, moldy carpet that should've been removed years ago. And just as we thought it couldn't be any worse...Our room was ghetto, our electric outlet had no covering and nearly every appliance in our room didn't work. We had a tiny, old t.v. in our room that didn't even work and everytime we used the blowdryer, the fuse would blow and the electricity would go out. Our bathroom wasn't the cleanest either...our floor had weird debris behind the bathroom door. Who knows what it was....
reviews.title: You can find better for the rate

reviews.text: More problems....Getting into our room was annoying because our key cards didn't work half of the time soo we would have to constantly go down to the reception desk and have them activate them again.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed the stay

reviews.text: It gets worse...The pool was scary. It looked like it hadn't been cleaned for weeks.
reviews.title: I wouldn't suggest it

reviews.text: I didn't expect a whole this2 1/2 star hotel which barely makes it to 2 star in my book to have the sam ammendities as a 3 star hotel, but it should atleast had working appliances. The only good thing about this hotel was its location. Its right near the beach and across the street from the SHORE CLUB, a really trendy nice hotel with an amazing pool and lounge. I don't recommend staying there for its price...you can find a nicer, cleaner hotel for the same rate. I would have given this hotel 2 star hotel an "Ok, but some problems" rating if itwasn't advertised as a 2.5 star hotel because its more like a motel.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!
What are yall thinking?
reviews.text: Don't waste your time here its not worth it.

The hotel website was cute and clean. It boasted a multi million dollar renovation. It also had a fabulous location on Collins Ave in the heart of SoBe. However, upon arrival the staff was virtually non-existent and employees present were useless. It seems the renovations were done in the lobby area only. The rooms were disgusting. I went with 3 other friends, so we had 3 rooms between us. One room was worse than the next. They were rundown, with the AC unit dripping water on the floor, bullet holes in the curtains, strange noises. There was a mildew odor in the room and the walls were beaten up. I would not recommend this place to anyone unless I hated them. It was disgusting and I would never stay there again. It was not worth any $.
reviews.title: Pleased!

likes.disliked: — Location of were our room was

reviews.text: At first I was worried because of all the negative review that I saw online. Once I got there I was at ease with seeing the reception area and greeted by the staff. The room was spacious and clean. Staff was pleasant throughout the whole trip. My only concern was them charging my account and having to do some reversing but other than that my stay was pleasing... I would stay here again...
reviews.title: sleep in your car instead

reviews.text: The night life was okay.. only thing is that they was not that much of a choice for getting something to eat .. Only a pizza/gyro place across the street that charged an arm and a leg for a meal..LOL
reviews.title: Not great for the money!
Lovely! Standard hotel, but better than i expected. Staff were lovely!
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel. It was basic, but more than i had expected after reading the reviews before i went.

reviews.title: Just fine!!
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and always kept clean, the staff were great, and very chatty, and helped us alot when we asked where to go out...
The pool was basic, but who wants to sit by the pool when you are in Miami?!
reviews.title: very pleasent stay.
Comfortable and Quiet
reviews.text: I really cant say more than it was what you would expect, no flashiness, just a clean, and VERY pleasant and comfortable stay.
About to book to go there again!
reviews.title: not so dour at the Dorchester

reviews.text: More like a Hell-Hole, there was a broken air Con unit rattling very loudly in the FILTHY windows (see our pictures) the TV and Fridge look NOTHING like the website pictures, and we had two queen size beds for four of us and no room for a rollaway.
reviews.title: They have sold our room although it was confirmed and even reconfirmed.

likes.disliked: — our room was sold and no alternative offered

reviews.title: Dont ruin your vacation! awful disgusting unexceptable
reviews.text: It was quiet and I would stay at the Dorchester again; make no mistake this is not a luxury hotel but is very functional in a plebian way

I would like to say that I have been traveling for the last 15 years staying in 15 to 45 hotels a year (over 500 lifetime). If traveling to a city for the second time usually a diffrent hotel each time. Anyway, I have never stayed in a worse establishment. I arrived to an older, 50's deco?, three story building. Not really knowing what to expect (first time to miami) it looked like the other hotels in the area so I was not concerned.
reviews.title: Go elsewhere if at all possible!
Not to bad.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Dorchester two times (six days each) during our latest FLorida vacation. The Hotel is not as bad as feared after reading the rewievs here.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: The hotel has a nearly perfect location close to shops and restaurants just across the street from the beach.

reviews.title: Dorchester Hotel - GREAT place for the avg college student!!
reviews.text: It has a pretty nice garden, a nice pool (happy hour 7-8 pm incluing free drinks was nice too).

reviews.title: Great location....thats it!
reviews.text: Boby is pleasant and it has a computer for guests to use for free (realy missed that on some other hotels).

I was in Miami Beach for a conference Sept. 24-28 and I had booked a room at the Dorchester mainly because I had read such positive reviews at this site. When I arrived, I was immediately uncomfortable. It struck me as the kind of place that rents rooms by the hour! The lobby was dimly lit, smelled of must and urine, had dirty lobby furniture, and the area used as a front desk looked as if it had been wiped down with a mud soaked cloth. walked into my room and was greeted by a huge stain in the middle of the carpet, odor of must/urine, and more dirty furniture. I picked up the phone to speak to the staff, and they were unable to hear me because the phone was broken. I could hear them, but they could not hear me. The only upside to the place was the bathroom, which looked as if it had been recently renovated, and belonged in a much better hotel. I didn't even set my bags down. I returned to the reception desk and immediately checked out. I was able to find a room at the Fountainbleau, which I highly recommend.
reviews.title: Absolutely awful!

reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel around 1:30PM, we were told there was no early check-in and we'd have to wait until 3:00PM for check-in. Ok, that's reasonable, so we went to lunch. Arriving back at the hotel, we were told they didn't have a queen, which we reserved, but only 2 doubles. I really wanted a queen, so we were told we'd have to wait even longer. Around 4:00PM we were finally shown to our room. The air conditioning was not working at all in this room and it was unbearablly hot. When we complained, they said they had no other rooms available. After much arguing, they finally let us stay in the model they had available. It was on the street level and right on the street. There were no curtains in this room, only blinds which were broken in places. This meant people on the street could see right into the room, not a very secure feeling to say the least! We had to keep the bathroom door closed as the odor coming from the bathroom was intolerable. Overall, this was one of the worst experiences I've ever had in a hotel. It was not a clean hotel, shabby and moldly smelling in the rooms and halls and the staff was not at all pleasant.
reviews.title: Won't stay here again
Gorgeous suite
reviews.text: Gorgeous suite, I was very impressed, I didn't expect it to be that good.

I was concerned about some the previous reviews I had read about the Dorchester Suites so I felt obligated to review it after my trip. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from the beach, a very short walk. You have easy access to the beach boardwalk and bricked pathway for morning walks. The suites are wonderful...large, well furnished. Everything was clean and the front desk responded quickly to our every need. Parking was $18 which was cheap for South Beach and you parked right at the hotel. Pool was very clean, warm and the poolside chaise lounges were the best I've ever seen. The price was unbelieveable for South Beach considering the size of the suite. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great place, great price

description: Located in a tranquil courtyard setting across from the beach; three blocks from the Historic District.
